description.db:para: This table is used by the carrierroute module to provide failure routing capabilities. More information is available at: &OPENSIPS_MOD_DOC;carrierroute.html

column.name: carrier
column.description: This column contains the carrier id.

column.name: domain
column.description: This column contains the route domain. Additional domains could be used for example as fallback.

column.name: scan_prefix
column.description: This column contains the scan prefix, which define the matching portion of a phone number.

column.name: host_name
column.description: This column contains the routing destination used for rule matching.

column.name: reply_code
column.description: This column contains the reply code used for rule matching.

column.name: flags
column.description: This column contains the flags used for rule matching.

column.name: mask
column.description: This column contains the mask that is applied to the message flags before rule matching.

column.name: next_domain
column.description: This column contains the route domain that should be used for the next routing attempt.

column.name: description
column.description: A comment for the route entry, useful for larger routing tables.
